definitions.definition: a complete list of items, typically one in alphabetical or other systematic order, in particular.
a list of all the books or resources in a library.
a publication containing details and often photographs of items for sale, especially one produced by a mail-order company.
examples: brochure, mailer, wish book; lookbook a mail-order catalog

definitions.definition: a descriptive list of works of art in an exhibition or collection giving detailed comments and explanations.
examples: directory, register, index, list, listing, record, archive, inventory a library catalog

definitions.definition: a list of courses offered by a university or college.
a series of unfortunate or bad things.
examples: his life was a catalog of dismal failures

definitions.definition: make a systematic list of (items of the same type).
examples: classify, categorize, systematize, index, list, archive, make an inventory of, inventory, record, itemize the collection is fully cataloged

definitions.definition: enter (an item) in a systematic list.
examples: the picture was withdrawn before being cataloged

definitions.definition: list (similar situations, qualities, or events) in succession.
examples: the report catalogs dangerous work practices in the company
